alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Cherokee; Cobb; Floyd; Haralson; Paulding; Polk (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 9:17AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Paulding, southwestern Cherokee, northeastern Haralson, Cobb, Floyd, central Fulton, Polk and southern Bartow Counties through 945 AM EDT... At 917 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Coosa to near Cartersville to near Sweat Mountain, and moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Atlanta, Marietta, Rome, Cartersville, Dallas, Cedartown, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Alpharetta, Smyrna, Kennesaw, Woodstock, Acworth, Powder Springs, Austell, Rockmart, Euharlee, Hiram, Emerson and Aragon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Bartow; Cherokee; Cobb; Floyd; Haralson; Paulding; Polk
